Posts.Content: Frustrated_Canadian wrote: I had my mastectomy 6 days ago.  Had my drains taken out yesterday by my surgeon, and he expressed concern for my nipple.  To best describe it, it looks like a prune.  It is purplish black in color, and not looking to healthy!  Saw my plastic surgeon today to discuss my upcoming expander surgery, and he expressed concern for my nipple.  He told me he wants to see me next week, to see what it looks like.  His thoughts are that if it does die and just falls off, we will have to wait months for the wound to heal, if we surgically remove it, he can do it at the same time as the expander surgery.  Just wondering if anyone else had this happen, and what courses of action they took. Posts.Content: Frustrated_Canadian wrote: I had posted previously about finding a lump in my remaining breast.  Well mammogram, and ultrasound yesterday confirmed that instead of the one lump I felt, there are four cysts in my remaining breast.  Due to the complications last time, my doctors, husband and myself have decided that I will finish this round of antibiotics and see if it does anything.  If it doesn't get rid of the cysts, then I will be scheduled for another mastectomy.  Kinda wishing that I would have insisted on having that breast removed at the same time as the right one, but hind site is 20/20 I guess. Posts.Title: Back on the crazy train Frustrated_Canadian Frustrated_Canadian

Posts.Content: Frustrated_Canadian wrote: As I have mentioned in my previous posts, I had my original mastectomy in January 2011 due to a two year chronic infection.  That has now cleared up, but found more cyst in the remaining breast, and finally got conformation that my mastectomy for the left side has been scheduled for December 22, 2011. I have mixed feelings, I can talk a blue streak about getting it done, and I am not worried about getting it done, people do not understand, but my BS and I both feel that it is better for me to do this, then wait for a cyst to get infected and start the two year infection train again.  I'm now having anxiety about this surgery, and going through all the feelings I went through previously.  We were planning on going to our house in Baja leaving on December 24, 2011, but that has been put on hold, as I highly doubt I'm going to be up to it two days out of surgery. Gosh, so much to do and get ready both at work and at home.  We have four children so forgoing Christmas really isn't an option. Sorry to post here, I always feel guilty as I know I'm very fortunate compared to other women, in the fact that I do not have breast cancer, but losing both my breasts is still a very traumatic experience for me. Any other near Christmas mastectomy ladies around? Posts.Content: Frustrated_Canadian wrote: My DH and I leave for our house in Mexico on April 21, and I just realized, that all my bathing suits are bikini's, and I'm having some serious issues.  I can't wear the top!  I wasn't planning on getting a prostheses as I will be having reconstruction hopefully starting in November, as long as there is no infection, and am very small breasted A cup, but am now thinking with the warmer weather, I don't know if I will be able to camouflage as well as in winter. What did other women do?  Did you get a prostheses, or just go natural?  At a lose here, don't want to out put the money, but at the same time, don't want to look lopsided.
